title: Arsenal captain Granit Xhaka shows support for Mesut Ozil after latest Unai Emery snub
text:

Arsenal captain Granit Xhaka has shown his support for Mesut Ozil after he was left out of the Gunners squad to face Vitoria in the Europa League.

The Switzerland international, who was also left out of the squad on Thursday, 'liked' the German's Instagram message to fans shortly after the Arsenal team was announced.

Alongside a picture of himself with Arsenal coach Robert Pires, Ozil tweeted: "Trained with this AFC legend this morning. Always a pleasure to see you my Bro Robert Pires. Best of luck for the match now from both of us."

Gunners fans showed their support for Ozil in big numbers by 'liking' the Instagram post, with Xhaka among those who acknowledged the message.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Meanwhile, some Arsenal fans could be heard signing Ozil's name during Thursday's match at the Emirates stadium, while another held up a banner in support of the German.

Former Gunners star Robin van Persie spoke out about the situation on BT Sport before the tie.

He said: "It's a shame, he's one of their best players.

"He's really good but something is not quite right at the moment with him and the coach so hopefully that gets solved for Arsenal.

(Image: Instagram/m10_official)

Martin Keown argued the other way, suggesting Emery has made the right call.

He said: "There is no doubt about his ability, it's the work ethic, it must be. Can he find a why to play him? I don't think he's as committed as I would like to see him, and I think there is evidence, there is hard evidence."
description: Unai Emery failed to name Mesut Ozil among the substitutes for Arsenal's Europa League clash with Vitoria
